Shreyan Chowdhury

Publications

Blog

Hi!

I am a PhD student at the Institute of Computational Perception in Johannes Kepler University Linz, Austria.

I work with deep learning models applied to music audio signals to understand what makes musical performances expressive and how we can make systems that respond appropriately to the subjective and affective qualities of music, perception of which is a uniquely human characteristic.

Currently I am a part of the Con Espressione project, and Prof. Gerhard Widmer is my supervisor.


Updates

2021

September 30, 2021: Passed my pre-defense colloquium! [slides]

August 19, 2021: Gave a talk at MAPLE lab, McMaster University titled “Towards Better Features for Music Emotion Recognition: A Machine Learning Approach”. [slides]

June 30, 2021: Presented our work on two-level explanations with sound sources and mid-level features at SMC 2021. [paper]

June 10, 2021: Presented our work on domain adaptation of perceptual features in music at ICASSP 2021. [paper]


2020

December 12, 2020: Patent granted for our work on audio analytics that I worked on while at Honeywell (project duration: 2017-18). [patent]


2019

November 5, 2019: Presented my work on explainable emotion recognition in ISMIR 2019, Delft. [teaser talk] [paper/poster/demo]

October 27, 2019: Presented our state-of-the-art results on emotion and theme recognition task at MediaEval 2019 in Sophia Antipolis, France. [paper]

October 16, 2019: Gave a guest talk at the Acoustics Research Institute, ÖAW (Austrian Academy of Sciences) with Verena Haunschmid on Explainable Models and their Application in Music Emotion Recognition.
